comment: Dr. A is an amazing professor who is truly passionate about OChem. I took the course over the summer, and although it was fast-paced, the SI sessions and lots of practice really helped me succeed. He also offered plenty of opportunities for extra credit, you have to participate tho. His practice exams are really helpful!

Very good teacher.  Very honest and repeats problems to make sure everyone gets it.  Will explain things multiple times a few different ways to make sure concepts are understood.  Consistently states "This is important for you to understand, would you like me to go over it again?".  Always available to discuss topics.  Highly recommend!

Avoid if you can, enjoys calling students out in a very unprofessional manner. Instead of talking to individuals out in the hall he will yell at you in front of the entire class. His behavior is out of the world…. AVOID
Beyond unprofessional takes personal feelings out on students and will patronize you. Will make fun of you for asking questions. Makes very inappropriate comments

genuinely brilliant professor. provides materials before the course for review (take advantage of them), uses pre lecture vids for content, assigns practice questions but not for a grade, active and funny in class, understanding of student circumstances, connects the material to real world applications. I think Dr. Aditya is my ideal professor fr

He was a very funny professor and took time in class to go over a lot of problems. Very little work, just make sure to review problems in the textbook because his test questions follow a similar format. Very easy class just don't slack off. Quizzes online with lockdown & webcam but they are easy and open note also can't go back to previous question

I took Dr. A's course during the summer, and I honestly wouldn't have ended with an A without ALL of the extra credit points he gave out. He doesn't curve exam grades, but the extra credit points will seriously save you. Graded pre-lecture notes and homework assignments were very helpful and he even allowed quiz corrections for more points.

Dr. Aditya is one of the most inspirational figures in my chemistry career so far. He is very clear in his lectures and instructions and will help you if you do not understand something. He is more than patient with his students, as long as you show an effort he is willing to help step by step throughout the semester. Absolutely take his class!

Best Organic Chemistry professor at ksu. You can tell he really cares about his students grades. I knew friends that took all other professors for Orgo 1 and regretted. They took Aditya for Orgo 2 and was very happy with the course. His style of lectures is different but effective. He will pass you as long as you make an effort.

Dr. A is the best organic chemistry professor at KSU. Classroom style is flipped, which is the best way to learn organic chemistry. He is really committed to helping everyone and wants everyone to pass the class. Come to class prepared, do plenty of practice problems, attend office hours/ SI sessions and it will be a smooth class!

THIS PROFESSOR IS THE ONLY REASON I PASSED ORGO 1!!! Please believe me when I say this class is difficult, but Dr.A really understands the material and can explain it to you in laymen's terms. He gives extra credit and his tests are similar to practice tests. I recommend doing problems in your textbook and attending every lecture.

Took his research lab and it was very difficult, if you don't remember Organic 1 Lab I wouldn't recommend. Lots of problem solving and critical thinking and one big group project at the end with a bit of a time crunch. He's great though, explains things well, and wants everyone to succeed.

He provides a surprising level of autonomy in letting students choose how the class will go. Lectures feel like discussions on the material which makes it way more engaging. Two tests and a final that were all open note, just come to class, two assignments and a presentation. If you don't hate chemistry, take this class! You won't regret it.

Dr. Aditya was super understanding at all times. He was always willing to help in any way he could. 2 open note, free response exams and open note, free response final, a 20 minute presentation with voiceover, and 2 assignments. Everything was pretty difficult but nothing was impossible, especially using the right resources.

Very good professor. He does care about his students, but his sarcasm can come off kinda rude sometimes. If I could take him for 3362, I would but he is not teaching it next semester (lecture not lab). He is really understanding but does get upset if you do not set up fast enough yet he talks for at least an hour before we actually start lab.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you have the chance to take Dr. A, take him! This is my 2nd attempt w/ a diff prof & his flipped teaching style helped me succeed in this course! He also made the summer course flexible. Show up to class, be active, use available resources ( S.I., practice test & problems, hw, extra credit, etc.) & you will do just fine.

Ochem 2 is difficult but Dr.A and the TAs are great. Does a flipped classroom which I found made class quick, fun, and relaxed. Exams and weekly quizzes are hard but your grade will be well fluffed with completion assignments, a project, and extra credit points. Dr.A enjoys teaching and is very good at it. Come prepared to class and youll do great.

Dr. Aditya cares SO much about his students. He genuinely wants everyone to do well and will do anything in his power to provide support for those who need it. I will definitely take him again. His exams are very similar to the practice exams that he provides, so there are no surprises. There are also extra credit opportunities. Great professor!

Lots of ways 2 improve ur grade (homework, project, weekly quizzes). LOOK AT THE PRACTICE TESTS HE PROVIDES BEFORE TAKING EACH TEST, THEY WILL HELP. Sometimes Dr. A is short with people but most of the time he is really willing to help u understand, even if it means setting up a time outside of class to meet. He also has an SI who is very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easily, THE OChem2 lab instructor to take. He's super helpful during lab, he always reviews the spectra of the compounds we create, so you're not completely on your own to find identify everything. No-brainer TAKE HIM!

Dr. A is the most understanding and passionate professor I've taken when it comes to assignments. 8 question quizzes about every week, a couple homework assignments, 3 exams and a final, and a project that hugely boosts your grade. OChem, in general, isn't easy but if you put in the work, you'll get the grade you want.

Dr. Aditya is an extremely hard and unfair grader. He can never tell you why he graded your assignment the way he did. He doesn't curve the class even though the majority of the class is failing. He is extremely rude and treats you as less of a person if you don't already know everything. If you want help don't ask him, ask the si.

I took Dr. Aditya for ORGO 1 (and ORGO 2). He's very passionate about the material he teaches, so oftentimes he expects similar energy/ comprehension from his students. Although this seems overwhelming, he has always been receptive to any questions/ comments/ pushbacks on the material if presentenced to him, so don't hesitate to engage!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Aditya is one of my favorite teacher, he cares soo much about his students. Organic is though ,but if you pay attention ask questions you will be fine and for credit he does lecture synopsis which helped me a lot. Participation is mandatory and a final project which worth 12.5% of the grade very nice i enjoyed his class a lot!

BEST ORGANIC PROFESSOR!! I took a different professor for organic 1 and i barely passed. He understands that this is a hard course and does everything he can to make this easier. There were quite a few extra credit opportunities that help a great deal. 3 tests plus a final and prelecture videos for every class.

It was Dr. As first time teaching this subject so it was a learning curve for everyone. No hwk assigned but we did have assignments, a presentation, & tests were open note. Gave typically a day to do the test but they were all FR. Was a really laid back class but the information was very heavy so be prepared to study, hes always willing to help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I had Dr. Aditya for Organic Chemistry I lab and I was a little nervous after seeing the reviews. I've heard his lectures are rough, but he was actually really great for lab. He can be a little obsessive over small things like leaving the cap off a reagent bottle etc. but he grades easy and will answer any questions.

Had him over the summer for this class and I had to drop it cause he was so unreasonable. when the whole class averages a 40 on a quiz whose fault do you think it is? well, he did not seem to think it was him. I wish any teacher in this department would care about their students' success.

Took him for 3361, and I knew I had to take again for 3362. The material is tough, but I think Dr. A does a great job of teaching it. Do the practice problems every week, watch pre-lecture videos (he does flipped classroom), and just listen to Dr. A! He wants you to succeed, but he isn't just going to hand it to you, you need to put in the effort.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Aditya is willing to help anyone who asks. Orgo is hard and you will have to work for your grade no matter what. Sometimes the way he explains stuff is hard to understand if you have never taken any orgo, but you can scrape by for the most part. He said the final was cumulative, but was very heavy on the last week of lecture. He is very caring!

This professor says in his syllabus to do the recommended reading and in text problems, but then doesn't release the recommended reading and in text problems until 20 minutes before class. I get it it we are having to do things differently because of COVID but the fact that he can't get reading for his students with enough time for us to read it.

My friends, professor aditya is a D+ professor. He knows the stuff but boy is it tough to learn from him. He will make you feel stupid hes done it to numerous people during lab. Whatever you turn in will not be sufficient. There has not been one assignment where he didnt email the whole class that they are pretty much stupid and make em redo it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: He has a tough love relationship with his students, if you put the time in this class you WILL be successful. Gives practice exams that are almost identical to real test. HW will likely be graded on completion. Watch lecture videos & take notes, quizzes usually based off them. Work hard & youll be okay, dont be afraid to get help go to SI or Dr.A
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Starts off very strict & grades the first couple assignments and then doesn't grade until the very end. when finals came, nothing was graded so we couldn't study prior labs. Everyone fails the finals because he doesn't have clear grading and now it's too late to review your grade bc the semester is over and everyone went home for the break.

Does a flipped classroom. Youll have 5 lecture videos to watch prior to class and then a quiz every lecture. Doesnt really teach in class. Posts practice exam prior to each test, but not really that similar to actual test. Test questions arent straight forward. Really wants you to know the concepts. Dont go to him for help hes mean. Go to SI.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Definitely the person you want to take for organic chem! He seems kinda standoffish at first but hell warm up to ya and he is super sweet. He is a pretty tough grader but I learned the most from him which will prepare you for biochem. Just don't be distracted during lecture (i. e. on your phone or not paying attention and talking). TAKE HIM!!

Two words, "the man". He has a bit of a tough grader, but this is organic chem, not gen chem 1. Great and genuine guy who wants you to do well. Exams are tough, but plenty of other points on the syllabus (quizzes, hw etc) to balance out your grade. 10/10 would recommend to anyone.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Rare example of someone who is a master of the material AND loves teaching (you usually get one or the other).One of the best professors I've ever had. Exams are straightforward (but not easy), and there are lots of points to cushion your grade if you fail the exams. 10/10 would take for any chem class he taught.
Great professor. Take no one else but him. Really helps you do well in the class.

Can be condescending at times, but he's honestly one of the sweetest and most caring professors you'll ever meet. He can be snappy (ie if he notices you're distracted/on your phone) and doesn't hold back if he's upset at the class, but just be a good student as you should be! Exams are very straightforward and have no surprises. 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Fantastic professor, I highly recommend taking him. You won't regret it.

Love him! First week he may be strict and rub you the wrong way, but he'll grow on you. He can be a bit salty at times if he sees people on their phone and has thrown people out of class and been a bit dramatic about it. However, his teaching & knowledge of organic chem is 2nd to none. Truly a master of the material. Exams are VERY straightforward.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: LOVE this guy. Yes, he's a harsh grader on the free response parts of his exams and he has an attitude sometimes towards distracted students (threw kids out of class a lot), but he more than makes up for it. Half your grade is simple quizzes and homeworks that are automatic 100s. Tests are hard, but the other points will help pass you
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: At first he seems super crazy difficult and not that caring (quiz on the 1st day, exam on orgo 1 stuff 2nd day DURING add-drop), but as the semester goes by, he'll grow on you. If you can get past the panic of the 1st week of class, he's SUPER sweet and not that hard. Now allows flashcards on exams to put your free response mechanism. Loved him.

LOTS of assignments/quizzes/busy work, but those points help you because the exams are kinda hard. He knows his exams are hard which is why he has all these other points built-in. He does a flipped classroom where lectures are posted online as a video, and in class its the assignments. If you can put up with the amount of busy work, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Absolutely love this guy! He grades free response part of exams VERY harshly, but he allows a flashcard on exams now (didn't use to before) and pretty much tells you what will be on the free response. Also, he allows retakes of MC section of the exam on D2L for 1/4 points back. Gives a quiz EVERY class which is annoying, but they're not hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Runs his classroom in a way where anyone can pass! He allows RETAKES of the multiple choice portion on D2L for 1/4 points back, he allows flash cards on exams & pretty much says which mechanisms will be on the test (just put those on your flashcard), and half of your grade comes from straightforward quizzes and HW. Not the type to trick you at all.

Really nice guy! Yes, he calls people out that are distracted during class, but you shouldn't be on Netflix during class anyways. His real exams are not just similar, but identical to assigned book problems, hw assignments, & quizzes. On exams he literally will put "This problem was #21 in the textbook and was your homework". Very straightforward.

Entire semester is 1,000 points, and only 550 come from exams including the final. Other 450 points are tedious (but not hard) in-class quizzes and homework assignments that you can easily get good grades on. In other words, you can miserably fail the exams, and can like still get a B because of all the homework and quiz points. You won't fail!

I absolutely LOVED Dr. A. He has his pros and cons. Cons, he grades his free response test questions VERY harshly and is a bit rude to students at time if he sees them on their phones (ie he's thrown kids out of class). Pros though, super sweet otherwise, LOTS of points available, and you can tell he wants everyone to do well. Highly recommend!

Tough class, but take advantage of office hours. He is super helpful when you make the effort to reach out. People below complain about the workload, but it's college folks. Nobody is here to hold your hand. Put in the effort (Don't just copy answers online) and you'll be fine.

Aditya in lab is fantastic. He is easy going, gives plenty of help. No reason to make below an A. He is accessible and talks to students like they are of equal level to him and doesn't make you feel bad for asking "dumb" questions. His quizzes and worksheets are definitely hard, but he helps. Best lab honestly, most chill.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Organic Chemistry 2 is the hardest class I have taken in all of college. Dr. A is a great professor and wants you to be awesome at chemistry. He is very helpful and friendly if you talk to him and go to his office hours. I am not going to pass this semester but plan to take him again next semester.

OChem Lab with Aditya is fantastic. He is funny and caring for his students. He comes and asks for feedback and casual conversations with students. He is helpful and gives take home quizzes that he helps you with. TAKE FOR LAB!!! I actually look forward to ochem lab because of him.

I took him for organic 1 and 2. The material for 1 is much harder in my opinion, but I put in minimal effort because quizzes were all online, and we had a take home test. From what I've heard he's better than other Prof's except he does not curve. Orgo 2 content was easier but the work load became heavy. I didn't look at the book and still made a B
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Do the weekly problems from the book and keep up with them, because those are the problems you usually see on test/quizzes. Utilize the professor/SI student. Communicate with Dr. Aditya, he can be understanding. Lot's of online lectures, but in class a lot of the time spent was working on problems, which was very helpful. He genuinely cares.

Dr. A is one if not the best science professor at KSU. Organic 2 is one of the hardest classes no matter who you take it with. But Dr. Aditya genuinely cares for you to understand the material. the class is very well structured and there is a lot of flexibility for you to learn the material. Do the work, read the guides and watch the videos.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This may come as a bit of a shock, but this class requires some work... sounds nuts i know, sounds crazy! Dr. A is outstanding, he's the sweetest professor you'll ever meet. Go to his office hours and practice and I guarantee that you will get at least a B. The people who didn't do well clearly didn't put in the effort to do well.
Please don't take him if you have a heavy class load. Tough grader when it comes to free response. The whole semester he never stopped by my desk once during in class assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lecture material and exam material don't match. Good luck to anyone who takes this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He will not give partial credit on exams. Mechanism problems on exam are worth 50 points. If you miss an arrow or charge you receive no points. He is abrupt and rude to everyone because he thinks he is better than any other O-chem professor. You have to study at least 60 hours a week to make a decent grade in this class.
take him!!!!

Personally I never really took notes and mainly focused on reading the book and doing practice problems. I didn't go to his office hours or SI, I never found them useful. He gives a lot of extra credit(75 points), but you have to work for it. Tests aren't that hard once you fully grasp the material. Makes you really work for an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Ochem 2 is a HARD class, so get ready to read! It was his 1st semester at ksu & he really cared for the success of his students. Went to 90% of office hours, SI, & only missed 2 lectures and made a B. Powerpoints are very helpful. Take home quizzes & exam. 5 question exams. Questions come from optional hw & quizzes. 65 pts of EXTRA CREDIT / 550.

He is outstanding. It's not really him that's difficult; it's that organic is an arduous class. I'm taking him again for chem 3362. He's such a sweet guy and really wants you to succeed. His tests are similar to the practice tests and the take-home quizzes. Truthfully, I'd take him for every class left for my degree.

Dr. A is an okay choice for lab. He generates his own protocols so they are not detailed enough so that they're easy to follow. He gives pre-lab quizzes which are alright and about 2-3 lab reports were completed for the whole semester. Talks a lot before lab so be prepared to spend the whole time in there. Helpful during lab as well along with TA.

Dr. A is great for ochem. Very helpful during office hours if you don't get the concepts during lecture and relatively responsive to emails. He tries to help as much as he can without giving you the answer because he wants you to learn. No h/w, mostly take home quizzes and up to 35pts EC. I'm taking him again for ochem2! Textbook is not mandatory.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Dr. A is a good professor but ochem is impossible in general and he doesn't help make it much better. His tests/final are 100% free response, 6-10 random quizzes throughout the semester, and no hw even though he makes you buy the access code. I also felt like he expected everyone to understand the material as soon as he said it. Wasn't great or bad
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: A very caring professor as long as you put in the work. Lectures are sometimes hard to follow. Read the textbook and practice because the mechanisms, reagents, and concepts of reactions are key for his tests and quizzes. He gave about 60 points worth of extra credit. Tests and quizzes were challenging. Organic is hard in general, so study well.

Do not take him unless you have any other options! He was not helpful when we had questions, he would just restate what you already knew and expect you to get it. He expected you to have worked the problems over before you went to office hours. Not the most accessible professor, came of kind of rude, especially when he fussed about his other class!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: He is an okay lab professor. He really wants you to learn so he will answer your questions without actually answering your question, so he can be a bit rude. His quizzes are hard, but he gives you the option to work in groups. He tells you what he wants in the lab report and he may let you make corrections on assignment from the semester
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: I almost feel bad saying bad things about Dr. A because he's so nice. No partial credit on exams, so expect averages to be in the 40's or 50's. However, he has given a lot of extra credit though in the form of extra quizzes. I wanna say it's been over 40 points worth, but you have to earn them (i.e. based on accuracy). Great dude, but VERY hard.

Dr. A is super nice and visibly wants his students to do well. He has a relatively thick accent but after a week or two he's understandable. O-Chem is a hard class no matter what and there wont be an easy A in organic chem. He tries really hard to help and his office hours are very group oriented so you get help from him and other students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: This man doesn't even have an accent and I can't understand what he's saying. When he explains stuff is in such weird ways that you'll end up even more confused when he's done with lecture. Tests are insanely difficult and all free response. However, he's really sweet and reminds me of a Big Bang Theory character, so there's that.

Cool dude, but very hard tests. Whole semester is 500 points: 3 exams, 1 final, and 100 points worth of take home quizzes. You can do quizzes in his office with him, and final replaces lowest test grade. Exams are harder than they need to be (all free response), and there's no curves. He's chill though, so there's that at least.

Literally one of the most personable and sweetest professors I've ever had, but he's SO HARD! When I say hard, I don't mean in the sense that you walk out learning a lot. I mean you walk out confused about what he said, and his tests are nightmares. Exams have been all free response so far, and they take the whole time. Again, great guy, but HARD!

The legit reviews of this guy keep getting deleted. I'll be as real as I can before this is deleted. He is a VERY sweet and caring guy, but his tests are HARD. No curves on his exams either. Also, sometimes when he teaches he talks about stuff in very complex terms, so go to SI sessions and extra tutoring! Great guy, but harder than he need to be.

I have enjoyed every lecture Dr. A has delivered so far. As they all say at KSU - you'll need to earn your grade and he is no exception. He requires you to read regularly. Don't take his class if you are looking for an easy "A" - he says he won't curve the class. Your Orgo-1 concepts need to be solid to do well in his Orgo-2.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures
